intro: Physostegia parviflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikeweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in spikes along the stem. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Physostegia parviflora is often found in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and streambanks.
